description: This bill creates a more thorough expungement mechanism that allows judges to permanently seal the criminal records of reformed offenders – making it easier for these Minnesotans to secure good jobs, access quality housing, and provide for their families.
title: Criminal record expungement governing provisions modified, business screening services required to delete expunged records, and eviction record expungement allowed in some cases.

description: This judiciary bill modifies the requirements to file a petition for relief from conviction, and modifies the notice requirement for offenders who owe restitution. The bill contains two Unsession provisions, and passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: Petition for relief from conviction modified, and notice to offender for restitution modified.

description: This public safety bill eliminates licensure for part-time peace officers. This bill passed the House 100-22 and the Senate 54-11.
title: Part-time peace office licensure eliminated.

description: This transportation bill removes the length limit for certain connector highways, and allows a one-week bid advertisement period for certain trunk highway contracts. The bill contains two Unsession provisions, and passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: Connector highways length limit removal; trunk highways one-week bid advertisement period

description: This bill clarifies that failing to pay court-ordered support is a crime. The bill passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: Court-ordered child support failure to pay crime clarification

description: This bill requires all new smartphones sold in Minnesota after July 1, 2015, to have an anti-theft “kill switch” function. This new kill switch function will allow smartphone owners to remotely disable their smartphone if it is lost or stolen, rendering the devices useless to thieves and reducing the incentive for a growing wave of violent cell phone thefts.
title: Smart phone antitheft (kill switch) protection and cellphones resale

description: This bill provides for the sale, storage, and other regulations of liquor. The bill authorizes and establishes various liquor licenses, and contains provisions for gambling fraud. This passed the House 120-10 and the Senate 49-15.
title: Omnibus liquor bill and lawful gambling fraud provision modification

description: The Women’s Economic Security Act (WESA), is nation-leading legislation designed to break down barriers to economic progress for women. WESA strengthens workplace protections and flexibility for pregnant women and nursing mothers, expands employment opportunities for women in high-wage, high-demand occupations, and reduces the gender pay gap through increased enforcement of equal pay laws.
title: Women's Economic Security Act (WESA) various provisions established and modified, and money appropriated.

description: This bill authorizes the Secretary of State obtain certain data from Department of Public Safety to increase voter registration and improve the accuracy of voter registration records. This passed the House 117-16 and the Senate 58-6.
title: Secretary of state authorized to obtain data from the Public Safety Department to share data.

description: This bill enacts new procedures and timelines to streamline the environmental permitting process, helping ensure that an estimated 11,000 of the 15,000 permit requests the state receives from businesses each year are completed in 90 days or less. Most of the remaining permits will be completed in less than 150 days.
title: Data classified, reporting requirements modified, permitting efficiencies modified and created, Pollution Control Agency duties modified, administrative penalty order and field citation provisions modified, civil penalties provided, rulemaking required, and money appropriated.

description: This bill updates and clarifies the statute governing licensing provisions for The Minnesota Board of Architecture, Engineering, Land Surveying, Landscape Architecture, Geoscience, and Interior Design Board. This bill passed the House 111-8 and the Senate 56-1.
title: Architecture, engineering, land surveying, landscape architecture, geoscience, and interior design profession license provisions modified.

description: This health bill improves access to health care delivered by advanced practice registered nurses and creates an advisory council. This bill passed the House 119-13 and the Senate 64-0.
title: Advanced practice registered nurses licensure and regulations; advisory council creation and appropriation

description: This public safety bill addresses the needs of incarcerated women during pregnancy and childbirth, and authorizes an advisory committee. The bill passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: Pregnancy and childbirth needs related to incarcerated women; advisory committee establishment

description: This bill allows a person who has brought a civil court action in district court for a violation of the Minnesota Human Rights Act, related to discrimination in employment, housing, credit, education, and other areas, to have a jury trial. This bill passed the House 79-51 and the Senate 55-0.
title: Unfair discriminatory practice jury trial entitlement

description: This bill is also known as “Steve’s Law,” after Steve Rummler, who died of a heroin overdose in 2011.   It allows certain non-health care professionals to administer a medication that can counteract a drug overdose.  The bill also provides some immunity from prosecution if an individual seeks emergency medical assistance in the case of a drug overdose. The bill passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: Steve's Law; ambulance service personnel drug overdose treatment authorization, drug overdose prevention, medical assistance authorization and liability limitation

description: This bill allows auto dealers to sell the vehicle at wholesale or retail instead of selling the vehicle by public auction when the auto dealer is a lienholder. The bill passed the House 119-7 and the Senate 66-0.
title: Personal property liens regulated, and sale of motor vehicle held by a licensed dealer provided.

description: This bill allows the South St Paul Public School District, by resolution, to change from election districts to at-large elections for its school board members. The bill passed the House 127-1 and the Senate 58-0.
title: Special School District No. 6, South St. Paul, authorized to dissolve election districts.

description: This bill allows Hennepin County Housing Redevelopment Authority and watershed districts in Hennepin County to join a regional collaboration reinvestment program. The bill passed the House 75-55 and the Senate 50-17.
title: Hennepin county multijurisdictional reinvestment program expansion

description: This is a technical bill that clarifies the roles and responsibilities of the Department of Human Services Office of the Inspector General.  The bill also establishes a task force under the Commissioner of Health to provide recommendations to integrate foregin-trained physicians into Minnesota’s health care system. The bill passed the House 129-0 and the Senate 54-0.
title: Human services licensing data, licensing, child care programs, financial fraud and abuse investigations, and vendors of chemical dependency treatment service provisions modifications; NETStudy use requirement

description: This transportation bill eliminates and modernizes antiquated, unnecessary, redundant and obsolete provisions. This bill contains 87 Unsession provisions. It passed the House 116-13 and the Senate 55-0.
title: Transportation Department; reporting requirements eliminated; antiquated, unnecessary, redundant, and obsolete provisions eliminated and modernized; and conforming changes made.

description: This natural resources bill appropriates money from environment and natural resources trust funds and modifies provisions for the Legislative-Citizen Commission on Minnesota Resources. This bill passed the House 99-29 and the Senate 47-15.
title: Environmental and natural resources trust fund appropriations provided, Legislative-Citizen Commission on Minnesota Resources provisions modified, and trust fund land acquisition requirements modified.

description: This bill requires commercial recycling to be available at many businesses in the seven-county metro area. The bill passed the House 76-53 and the Senate 37-25.
title: State government resource recovery provisions modifications

description: This local government bill authorizes four-year terms for the Grand Rapids Public Utilities Commission. The bill passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: Grand Rapids public utilities commission members four-year term authorization

description: This labor bill provides procedures for how local governments and school districts handle collective bargaining agreements and protect employees when entering a new joint powers agreement. This bill passed the House 77-49 and the Senate 39-23.
title: Public employment joint powers agreement employee protections authorization

description: This Unsession bill removes and modifies obsolete, unnecessary and redundant laws and rules administered by the Department of Commerce and the Public Utilities Commission. The bill eliminates obsolete laws like carrying fruit in an illegally sized container, regulating insurance policies sold in vending machines, and regulations specific to the telegraph. The bill contains 184 Unsession provisions and passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: Commerce Department and Public Utilities Commission; obsolete, unnecessary, or redundant laws and rules removed, and conforming changes made.

description: This energy bill regulates the routing process for high-voltage transmission lines and prohibits the designation of a preferred route in the permitting process. The bill passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: High-voltage transmission line routing process regulated, and designation of a preferred route prohibited in the permitting process.

description: This local government bill modifies definitions that apply to municipal boundary adjustments.  The bill passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: Annexation definitions provided, and annexation by ordinance of parcels limited.

description: This bill updates the definition of a confidential employee. This bill passed the House 79-46 and the Senate 36-23.
title: Confidential employee definition changed.

description: This corrections bill amends and repeals outdated and redundant statutes. The bill contains 18 Unsession provisions, and passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: Corrections; outdated and redundant statutes amended and repealed.

description: Chapter 217, SF 2449: This Unsession bill authorizes the purchase of a dam, and public and private sales and exchanges of certain state lands. The bill also merges two state parks, modifies boundaries for state forests and recreation areas, and modifies the disposition of certain land and revenue. The bill contains 5 Unsession provisions and passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: Omnibus lands bill

description: This bill designates a segment of Route No. 46 (U.S. Highway 8), from the southwestern border of Chisago City to the eastern border of Center City, to be named “Nicholas Patrick Spehar Memorial Highway.” The bill passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: Nicholas Patrick Spehar Memorial Highway designated.

description: This commerce bill updates laws regulating liens on personal property in self-storage. The bill passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: Minnesota liens on personal property in self-service storage act update and provisions modifications

description: This bill authorizes local governments to transfer cemetery property to a tribal cemetery association. The bill passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: Cemetery property transfer to tribal cemetery association authorized by local governments.

description: This public safety bill prohibits individuals from possessing weapons if they are subject to domestic violence restraining orders. The bill requires individuals to surrender their firearms if they have been convicted of domestic violence offenses. The bill provides penalties for those who fail to comply. This bill passed the House 111-15 and the Senate 60-4.
title: Domestic violence restraining order provisions modified to prohibit persons subject to the restraining orders from possessing weapons, and persons convicted of domestic violence offenses required to surrender their firearms while they are prohibited from possessing firearms.

description: This public safety bill amends and repeals outdated and redundant statutes. The bill also requires a report on the collection of data on victims of domestic abuse. This bill contains 39 Unsession provisions and passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: Public Safety Department; outdated and redundant statutes amended and repealed, and report required on collection of data on victims of domestic abuse.

description: This bill creates the Public Employment Relations Board to hear unfair labor practice claims under the Public Employee Relations Act. This passed the House 74-59 and the Senate 35-26.
title: Public Employment Relations Board created, rulemaking authorized, and money appropriated.

description: This elections bill allows the Saint Louis County Board to designate a two-year term for the district 7 board seat following the 2014 election. After the 2016 election, the seat turns back into a four-year term, staggering terms as required by state law. The bill passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: St. Louis County; District 7 commissioner 2014 election term changed to two years.

description: This corrections bill eliminates a requirement that counties be contiguous in order to qualify for a grant for correctional services. This passed the House 126-6 and the Senate 60-0.
title: Correctional services delivery; contiguous counties qualification requirement eliminated.

description: This data practices bill classifies checking account numbers as nonpublic data. The bill passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: Checking account numbers classified as nonpublic data.

description: This bill authorizes special license plates for women veterans. This bill passed the House 118-0 and the Senate 54-9.
title: Special women veterans license plates authorized, and money appropriated.

description: This Unsession bill authorizes the Saint Paul Port Authority to conduct meetings by telephone or other electronic means. The bill contains one Unsession provision. It passed the House 111-14 and the Senate 56-0.
title: St. Paul Port Authority; meetings by telephone or other electronic means authorized.

description: This Unsession bill allows housing courts and housing calendars to use referees for the majority of landlord and tenant cases. This bill contains 1 Unsession provision. The bill passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: Housing courts and housing calendars allowed to use referees almost exclusively for lanflord and tenant cases.

description: This courts bill streamlines several process improvements for litigants and changes several laws to further enable the court to move toward electronic court record processing. This bill contains 7 Unsession provisions. The bill passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: Candidate petitions and ballots; errors and omissions petitioners shall also serve the petition on all candidates for the office in which the error or omission is alleged, raised court seal and notarial act requirements eliminated, court document signatures provided under penalty of perjury, probate alternative service permitted, structured settlement transfer action applicants required to provide information to court, temporary restraining order request hearing provided to be made within 20 days, and application of fine payment to restitution before application to court fines permitted.

description: This health bill modifies the newborn screening program. The bill passed the House 69-58 and the Senate 36-20.
title: Newborn screening program modification

description: This bill modifies the review process of district judge disposition to comply with 90-day disposition requirements, allowing for notice and action to be taken. The bill passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: Judicial standards board monthly district judge review requirement

description: This criminal justice bill modifies judicial forfeiture provisions in certain cases. This bill passed the House 120-0 and the Senate 55-5.
title: Judicial forfeiture of property associated with controlled substances offenses and vehicles used in drive-by shootings conviction requirement

description: This courts bill clarifies existing law related to partial payment or reimbursement of costs from a party proceeding in forma pauperis. The bill passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: Forma pauperis party proceeding partial payment or reimbursement of costs amended.

description: This commerce bill modifies the regulation of real estate brokers and salespersons. The bill passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: Real estate broker and salesperson regulation modified.

description: This commerce bill regulates certain licensees. The bill modifies education requirements, enforcement provisions and other actions. The bill prohibits certain homeowners policy surcharges. The bill contains 22 Unsession provisions related to the federal conformity of insurance laws. The bill also enacts Unsession changes proposed by the National Association of Insurance Commissioners. This bill passed the House 102-23 and the Senate 56-0.
title: Licensees regulated, education requirements modified, technical changes made, enforcement provisions and other actions modified, homeowner policy surcharges prohibited, and insurance holding company systems regulated by enacting changes proposed by the National Association of Insurance Commissioners.

description: This family law bill makes changes to custody and parenting time provisions. The bill passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: Custody and parenting time provisions changes made.

description: This Unsession bill relating to the Department of Administration eliminates statutes that are no longer necessary for state agency business needs. The bill reorganizes the state’s procurement code for consistency and accessibility. This bill also makes it easier for over 25,000 businesses, nonprofits, and local governments to interact with the state to receive state contracts. This bill contains 21 Unsession provisions. It passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: Administration department and state procurement provisions updates and technical corrections, language elimination and conforming amendments

description: This local government bill repeals an authorization for the creation of the Grand Rapids Central School Commission. This bill passed the House 125-1 and the Senate 60-0.
title: Grand Rapids central school commission authority repeal

description: This transportation bill modifies the description of permitted uses of vehicles for testing. The bill passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: Vehicles used in environmental testing permitted uses modification

description: This bill creates a Legislative Commission on Data Practices and Personal Data Privacy. The bill passed the House 124-3 and the Senate 63-0.
title: Data practices and personal data privacy legislative commission establishment

description: This bill eliminates and modernizes antiquated, unnecessary, and obsolete health provisions. This bill contained 15 Unsession provisions. The bill passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: Adult children of a deceased parent added to the definition of patient.

description: This mortgage foreclosures bill amends the definition of a “small servicer”. The bill also clarifies the statute of limitations for certain foreclosure claims. The bill passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: Small servicer definition amended relating to mortgages, and Foreclosure Curative Act clarified.

description: This bill relates to the automated property system (APS) for tracking scrap metal and scrap vehicle transactions. It delays the implementation date and establishes parameters for a transaction fee. The bill passed the House 113-17 and the Senate 62-0.
title: Automated property system transaction fee schedule established, state auditor authorized to examine fee schedule, effective dates delayed for automated property system, and reports required.

description: This bill updates the Uniform Interstate Family Support Act. The bill passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: Uniform Interstate Family Support Act updated.

description: This housing bill establishes remedies for victims of violence to terminate lease agreements. The bill also establishes a Housing Opportunities Made Equitable pilot project. The bill passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: Landlords and tenants; victims of violence remedies established, and housing opportunities made equitable pilot project established.

description: This Unsession bill updates provisions in grants and contract management processes. The bill also provides an encumbrance exception in the grant process. This bill contained one Unsession provision. The bill passed the House 126-1 and the Senate 59-0.
title: Grant management process and contract management provisions changed, and encumbrance exception in the grant process provided.

description: This public safety bill requires a driver to stop and investigate possible personal injury or property damage following a collision. This bill passed the House 124–3 and the Senate 45-16.
title: Motor vehicle collisions driver must stop requirements clarification and terminology change

description: Chapter 185, HF 2096: This bill authorizes a state online voter registration system. The bill also allows citizens to apply for absentee ballots through the Secretary of State’s website. This bill received bipartisan support, passing the House 129-2 and the Senate 41-24.
title: Campaign finance definition modified, and voter registration and absentee ballot application online submission provided.

description: This insurance bill authorizes certain benefits for Minnesota FAIR plan and Minnesota Joint Underwriting Association employees. The bill also provides conforming and technical changes. The bill passed the House 123-3 and the Senate 42-22.
title: Minnesota FAIR plan employees or joint underwriting association employees elective eligibility for insurance coverage authorization

description: This local government bill authorizes District One Hospital to sell property and provides for the dissolution of a hospital district. This bill passed the House 131-1 and the Senate 58-0.
title: District One Hospital authorized to sell real and personal property, and hospital district dissolution provided.

description: This Unsession bill adopts recommendations from the Workers' Compensation Advisory Council. This bill contained 7 Unsession provisions. The bill passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: Workers' Compensation Advisory Council recommendations adopted.

description: This Unsession bill removes obsolete, redundant, and unnecessary laws related to the Department of Agriculture. This bill also modifies biodiesel fuel requirements. This bill contained 61 Unsession provisions. The bill passed the House 116-0 and the Senate 61-1.
title: Agriculture Department-administered obsolete, redundant, and unnecessary laws removed; and biodiesel fuel requirements modified.

description: This public safety bill restructures the criminal vehicular operation statute by creating separate sections relating to criminal vehicular homicide and criminal vehicular operation. The bill does not make substantive changes to the crime. The bill passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: Criminal vehicular homicide or operation statute technical amendments authorization and driving while impaired law compatibility establishment

description: This bill requires lifeguards at public beaches to have certain minimum safety training. This passed the House 110-10 and the Senate 52-14.
title: Tony Caine's Law

description: This health bill modifies the use of the all-payer claims data. The bill convenes a work group to make recommendations on expanded uses of the all-payer claims database. This passed the House 80-48 and the Senate 46-13.
title: All-payer claim data use modified, and work group convened to make recommendations on expanded uses of the all-payer claims database.

description: This public safety bill increases the time-limit for warrantless arrests from 24 hours to 72 hours for warrantless arrests in misdemeanor and gross misdemeanor domestic abuse offenses. This bill also clarifies probable cause arrests for violations of protection, restraining, and no contact orders. The bill passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: Probable cause arrests clarified for violations of protections, restraining, and no contact orders; and time limit modified for probable cause arrests for domestic abuse.

description: This elections bill extends the deadline for counties to purchase voting equipment with Help America Vote Act grants. The bill received unanimous bipartisan support in both chambers.
title: Help America Vote funds deadline for voting equipment purchase extension

description: This transportation bill amends regulations for limousines. This passed the House 100-21 and the Senate 57-0.
title: Limousine regulation amended.

description: This Unsession bill makes technical changes affecting the Minnesota Historical Society, including amending language to include correct addresses and names. The bill passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: Minnesota Historical Society technical changes made.

description: This bill enables Safe at Home program participants to buy property in a manner that protects their identities. The Safe at Home program is an address confidentiality program designed to help survivors of domestic violence, sexual assault, stalking, or others who fear for their safety. The bill passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: Safe at home program participant data and real property records regulated.

description: This bill provides rules for the organization and operation of public benefit corporations. This passed the House 110-16 and the Senate 48-16.
title: Minnesota Public Benefit Corporation act; public benefit corporations organization and operation provided.

description: This bill requires that courts allow simultaneous competency and civil commitment examinations for defendants facing criminal charges in certain circumstances. It will reduce the time people with serious mental illness stay in jail without access to mental health treatment before being civilly committed. The bill passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: Defendant simultaneous competency and civil commitment examinations requirement

description: This bill amends provisions relating to corporations and limited liability companies. This bill passed 95-32 in the House and 62-0 in the Senate.
title: Business organization prefiling document review provided, and limited liability companies and business corporations regulated.

description: This bill exempts individuals who perform threading from needing a license and gives the Board of Cosmetology Examiners authority to update their rules to reflect this exemption. The bill passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: Threading exemptions provided, and good cause exemption authorized for rulemaking.

description: This public safety bill requires forensic laboratories to become accredited. This legislation was created after the St. Paul Crime Lab suspended drug testing in 2012 when two workers and the former director testified that the lab had no standard procedures for drug testing, and did not document steps taken while testing evidence for drugs. This bill passed the House 115-15 and the Senate 64-0.
title: Forensic laboratories accreditation

description: This bill authorizes the adoption of a local county government plan in Dakota County. This bill passed the House 109-18 and the Senate 50-16.
title: Dakota county local government plan adoption

description: The bill increases the minimum wage in Minnesota to $9.50 per hour by 2016, and indexes it to inflation. This bill passed the House 71-60 and the Senate 35-31.
title: Private and public employee labor standards provided, minimum wage regulated, and state employee use of donated vacation leave regulated.

description: This bill prohibits certain practices in connection with a sales representative agreement. The bill passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: Sales representative agreement certain practices prohibition

description: This bill modifies drainage system provisions. The bill passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: Drainage systems provisions modifications

description: This food safety bill defines permitting rules for food product sampling and demonstration; with an exemption for a chili or soup cook-off event. The bill passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: Food licensing law expansion; farmers market definition and food product sampling and demonstration allowance; chili and soup cook-off fund-raiser events food inspection requirements exemption

description: This bill updates the Board of Cosmetologist Examiners statute and gives the board the authority to quickly update their rules. This bill also changes the composition of the Board and revises requirements for professional associations offering continuing education and for cosmetology schools. The bill passed the House 127-2 and the Senate 47-19.
title: Cosmetologist examiners board provisions modifications

description: This bill repeals obsolete, redundant, and unnecessary laws and rules under the direction of the Minnesota Housing Finance Agency. The bill also changes a State Register notice requirement that streamlines and provide easier public access to information. This bill passed the House 129-3 and the Senate 66-0.
title: Housing finance agency (HFA) obsolete, redundant, and unnecessary laws repeal and conforming changes

description: Safe and Supportive Schools Act. This bill provides local school districts the guidance, support, and flexibility to adopt clear and enforceable school policies to help protect all children from bullying, and to reinforce the principles of tolerance and respect in Minnesota's schools. This bill passed the House 69-63 and the Senate 36-31.
title: Safe and supportive schools provided by prohibiting bullying.

description: This bill designates March 31 as Cesar Chavez Day in the State of Minnesota. This bill passed the House 83-45 and the Senate 57-1.
title: Cesar Chavez day designation

description: This bill ensures continued employer health insurance contributions for Department of Corrections employees who are permanently and totally disabled on the job. The bill passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: Former correctional employees continued employer insurance contributions requirement

description: This bill regulates the organization and operation of limited liability companies, providing changes to increase uniformity and conformity. The bill passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: Limited liability company organization and operation regulated, and Minnesota Revised Uniform Limited Liability Company Act enacted.

description: This bill modifies human services appropriations in order to correct the law to match the intent of the 2013 Legislature. Without this language, there would be unintended reductions to funds for children’s services and adult mental health grants. The bill passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: Human services grant programs prior appropriation modification

description: This bill designates a segment of marked Trunk Highway 36 as "Officer Richard Crittenden, Sr., Memorial Highway." The bill passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: Officer Richard Crittenden. Sr. memorial highway designation

description: This bill removes the residency requirement for deputy registrars. This bill passed the House 131-0 and the Senate 61-4.
title: Deputy registrars residency requirement removal

description: This bill updates Minnesota statute to conform to new rules of civil procedure for discovery plans, so that the full 180 days of discovery mandated by the legislature to prepare expert affidavits is maintained. The bill passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: Expert review certification time limits adjusted because of recent amendments to the Minnesota Rules of Civil Procedure.

description: This bill removes five obsolete, redundant, and unnecessary laws related to military affairs. Laws removed through this bill date back to 1921, including state requirements for National Guard uniforms and equipment, which are now covered by federal law. The bill passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: Military affairs obsolete, redundant, and unnecessary laws removed.

description: This bill ratifies labor agreements and compensation plans for state employees. This bill passed the House 84-48 and the Senate 43-22.
title: Labor agreements and compensation plans ratification

description: This bill enacts $508 million in tax cuts for Minnesotans. The bill makes changes to individual income, corporate franchise, property, sales and use, estate, mineral, local, and other taxes and tax-related provisions; changes property tax aids and credits; modifies education aids and levies; makes changes to additions and subtractions from federal taxable income; provides for federal conformity; changes tax rates for estates; modifies income tax credits; modifies estate tax provisions; repeals the gift tax; modifies the definition of sale and purchase; modifies sales tax exemptions; modifies tax increment financing rules; modifies the distribution of taconite production taxes; and modifies and provides provisions for public finance.
title: Taxation; individual income, corporate franchise, property, sales and use, estate, mineral, local, and other taxes and tax-related provisions changed; property tax aids and credits changed; education aids and levies modified; federal taxable income addition and subtraction changes made; federal conformity provided; estate tax rates changed; income tax credits modified; estate tax provisions modified; gift tax repealed; sale and purchase definition changed; sales tax exemptions modified; tax increment financing rules modified; taconite distribution production taxes modified; public finance provisions modified and provided; and money appropriated.

description: This bill reduces verbiage by eliminating unnecessary and redundant laws relating to Higher Education. The bill passed unanimously in both chambers.
title: Higher education statutes modernized, streamlined, and clarified; unnecessary, or redundant laws and rules eliminated; and obsolete language and unnecessary verbiage deleted.

description: This bill makes the Blue Earth County Library Board advisory to the County Board. The bill passed in the House 119-6, and in the Senate 64-0.
title: Blue Earth County; library board made advisory to the county board.

description: This bill makes changes to reimbursement classifications for residents of nursing homes and boarding care homes.
title: Online learning advisory council provisions modifications

description: This bill provides a process for certain county offices to be made by appointment rather than by election, in Jackson, Lake, Clay, Kandiyohi, and Lyon Counties.
title: Jackson, Lake, Clay, Kandiyohi and Lyon counties offices appointive process authorization

description: This bill will appropriate money for low-income home energy heating assistance.
title: Low-income home energy heating assistance funding provided, and money appropriated.
